intro: Friesodielsia mindorensis, commonly known as the Mindanao starling tree, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a smooth surface. It typically grows in lowland to montane forest areas, preferring well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
